column3: How are interviewees incentivised?

Is the client part of the SVS?
How can we contact the end users?

column3: What are the constraints?
column6: Schedule, Scope, Budget.

column3: What is the biggest thing which is outside the scope of this project
What will the service be in 1 year, 2 years from now
Are all parts, required to make the service work, budgeted for?
column6: All mobile platforms, back-end services, Gateways, CI systems, .....

column3: What is the availability of the team members?
What has been the most wasteful activity so far?
If you had one week for somebody in the team to learn something. Who and what would that be?

If we could have done things differently, what would have made the client twice as happy?
What practise from this project would you recommend every single other project to adopt?

Are there any other parties in the client organisation who have to approve the designs?
Have we challenged the business case?
Have we challenged the concept?
Have we challenged the brand guidelines

How do we store/share/version control assets?
Do the developers have all assets?
Are all designs possible (or easy enough) to implement?
Have the designs been peer reviewed by other Futu designers
Have all the stakeholders approved the designs?
Have all the stakeholders seen the designs?
Is our design aligned with the brand
What are the incentives for the PO?
column6: Think also about bonus schemes, personal ambition etc.

column3: Is there anything unknown about the release process?
column6: Test release build process, walk through acceptance and deployment/store release steps.

column3: Is there anything in the backlog which could be postponed to the next release?

column6: Who decides, how to avoid undue peer pressure, any extra compensation?

column6: Some organisation have limitations in the form of a blacklist (or white-list) for 3rd party libraries.

column3: Who own the Intellectual property rights?
Does the contract stipulate where the work should be carried out?
What, if any, are the contractual obligation the client has to fulfil to enable project success?

column3: What is the most important thing to improve related to inside team communication?
What information was missing from the on-boarding?
column6: If there are people who joined after the project started.

column3: What is the most significant change in the constraints since the beginning?
column6: Budget, scope, schedule

column3: How happy are we with the backlog? How can we make it better?
Are we working on the most valuable item?
What is the most relevant feedback we have received from the end-user so far?
If the client would decide to cancel the project what would be the reason?
In which way have we disappointed the client the most?
How well is the team working as a team and how could it be better?
What is the biggest thing we haven't told the client.
Based on the current burn-rate how long will the budget still last
What is the most valuable thing we have done for the client so far?
What is the most surprising thing you learned about the client?
What in the team set up would you most like to change?
What technological aspect would you most like to change?
Are there any assumptions you made in the beginning which did not hold and what is the impact?
If the project crosses borders, what is the plan with regards to travelling?
Who pays for project expenses (think of travel, licence and other costs)
If your team is not all sitting at the same location, how often do you co-locate or rotate team members?
If we knew at the start what we know now, what would we have done different?
Is the amount of technical debt we have created acceptable?
What 3 things would you like to change?
What direction is the team’s motivation going?
Is the client happier than at the start of the project?
What has been the biggest surprise in the project so far?
What is the difference between the on-boarding of original team members vs those who joined later?
Compared to the beginning, what has changed in the client's business case?
Why should we continue with the project
Are we currently ahead or behind our expectations from the beginning of the project.
column6: Think about budget, scope and schedule.

column3: Compared to the beginning, what is the most important thing that has changed?
How do you help others get into the flow?
column6: You can make agreements about disturbing, working hours when to plan meetings etc.

column3: When the team is fully running how much budget is used per week?
column6: Fully running means the team after ramp-up so based on the normal allocation of the team.

column3: Do all the team members have all the relevant credentials

How much budget/time is reserved for deployment to production?

column6: PM services are things like invoicing, reporting, meetings, finding new team members, ....

column3: What PM services are required to be done by the team? And is this budgeted?
column6: Think about invoicing, reporting, meetings, finding new team members, ....

column6: Saying no is not easy, think if you are comfortable saying no.
